diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute cholecystitis, Acute Diastolic Congestive Heart Failure, Atrial fibrillation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with progressive abdominal pain, elevated WBC count, and imaging findings of gallbladder thickening and distension with an impacted gallstone, leading to the diagnosis of acute cholecystitis. Additionally, vital signs indicated possible diastolic congestive heart failure.
